## StraightSegment.pointOnPath() method

returns the point on the segment's path that is 'location' along the length of the path, where 'location' is a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive. for the straight line segment this is simple maths.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
pointOnPath(location: number, absolute?: boolean): PointXY;
```

|  --- | --- | --- |
|  location | number |  |
|  absolute | boolean |  |

<b>Returns:</b>
